title: Active Learning-Based Online Social Course for Strengthening Vocational Dynamics Leadership Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of occupational health and safety management, foundational data analysis skills, and understanding of industrial workplace social dynamics (worker-manager relationships, workplace culture)
context.additional_context: A practical workplace dynamics education course for learners in managerial/leadership roles. Combines real-time interaction and project-based assessment in a BYOD environment. Social elements such as organizational culture improvement, worker rights protection, and sustainable workplace environment construction are emphasized.

learning_goals: Identification of at least three social risk factors in industrial workplaces (e.g., worker rights violations, workplace culture issues) by applying occupational dynamics data analysis methodologies.

Through 2 weeks of active learning activities (3 case studies, 2 discussions, 1 simulation), learners will design one workplace occupational disease prevention strategy and deliver a 5-minute presentation achieving at least 2 points (out of 3) based on peer evaluation criteria (clarity, practicality, creativity). The process must include communication improvement strategies between workers and managers.

During a 2â€“4 week mid-term course, learners will develop one safety management system applicable to real corporate environments (manufacturing/logistics) through team-based projects and submit a report meeting at least two out of three predefined evaluation criteria (risk assessment, procedural clarity, feasibility). The report must include worker participation processes and social impact assessments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
